cyclone.name: ROSA
cyclone.current_location: about 385 miles southwest of Punta Eugenia, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving north, then forecast to turn north-northeast toward the central-northern Baja California Peninsula and quickly into the Desert Southwest of the United States
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central-northern Baja California Peninsula near Cabo San Quintin / Punta Eugenia

weather_observation.watch_coast: East coast of the Baja California Peninsula from Bahia de los Angeles to San Felipe
weather_observation.warning_coast: West coast of the Baja California Peninsula from Punta Abreojos to Cabo San Quintin
weather_observation.impacted_coast: West coast of Baja California, northwestern Sonora, southern California coast, and the Desert Southwest
weather_observation.wind: Breezy to windy conditions possible; peak gusts could reach 25–35 mph with a low (≈3%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; however, long-period swells will elevate surf and rip-current risk.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible Monday into Tuesday, locally higher in showers.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents beginning Sunday night and lasting through Tuesday.
